intro: Hieracium hagstroemii, commonly known as Hagströms hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
